title: I can no longer drag a person to the BCC line. How do I fix this?
creator: jeremy40

title: Move from gmail to tbird
content:
I used Thunderbird for a lot of years, and I liked it. A few months ago my ISP blew up and died, and I had to reconfigure everything for a new ISP. I figured Gmail was a decent email-storage ISP, and I'd use Tbird for the email client. That's what I did with my old ISP.

My laptop was 8 years old, so when my ISP died I got a new one. I assumed I'd be able to copy the Data folder onto my new laptop, and point my new Tbird at it. That's basically what I did the last time I got a new laptop. No such luck, the new Tbird doesn't see the old config or message history. Not sure why. So I started using Gmail's mailer interface. Bad mistake. I HATE Gmail, specifically the Gmail web interface.

Ideally I would like to copy my Tbird history onto my new laptop, merge the old Tbird messages with the Gmail history from the last few months, and move onto Tbird for day-to-day use. I see many messages suggesting conversion processes, but I'm confused by the OAuth issues &etc, and I'm not sure if/how I can do the merge. Help?
creator: garyfritzz

title: Outlook Calendar and Contact Sync – When Will It Be Available?
content:
Hello Thunderbird community,

I’ve been exploring Thunderbird’s integration options and noticed that while email sync with Outlook accounts works fine, calendar and contact synchronization with Outlook/Exchange Online is currently unavailable.

This is a significant limitation for users who rely on Outlook’s ecosystem for scheduling and address book management. I’d like to ask:

Is there an official roadmap for when Outlook calendar sync will be supported in Thunderbird?

Will Outlook contacts sync be added at the same time, or as a separate feature?

I believe many users would benefit from clarity on this, since full Outlook integration is critical for those working in Microsoft-centric environments.

Thanks in advance to the Thunderbird team and volunteers for any updates or guidance.
creator: stank-appease-tug
